biography.content:
I am a research scientist with the Child and Youth Data Laboratory (CYDL) at the ACCFCR. The CYDL links and analyzes administrative data from child- and youth-serving ministries in the Government of Alberta. 

The CYDLâ€™s research provides groundbreaking opportunities to understand relationships between multiple factors in the lives of children and youth in Alberta. Population-based and cross-sectoral analysis provides relevant evidence for integrated policy and coordinated services.

The CYDL is managed by the Alberta Centre for Child, Family and Community Research (ACCFCR). The Centre develops, supports and integrates research across sectors and disciplines to provide a strong, evidence-based foundation for identifying and promoting effective public policy and service delivery to improve the well-being of children, families, and communities in Alberta, Canada, and internationally. 

See CYDL's Project 1: Experiences of Albertan Youth
http://www.research4children.com/admin/contentx/default.cfm?PageId=8537
